Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, this film depicts his adolescence in the country, the ideals he holds about the agricultural, and his ideals in regards to human nature, which was highly influential on the Japanese war efforts in World War II.

I had mixed feelings for "Les Valseuses" (1974) written and directed by Bertrand Blier when I started watching it but I ended up loving it. A woman who hates cats (Alice Krige) and her son (Brian Krause) have moved into a small town, and must deal with a mean cat. The cat, whom Alice has brought from abroad, comes with an Egyptian cat-goddess named Anima, who can take over one and turn her into a cat-creature with the help of a snake with a human head called Azrael.
